page.title: 02THE CHINA CLAY INDUSTRY PT1
page.content: The largest extractive industry in Cornwall today is the mining of {China {Clay}and the highest quality is to be found in the area. The granite rock which forms the hills of Devon and Cornwall was subjected to severe faulting and folding about 300 million years ago.Geologists tell us that it was during this Carboniferous Period that kaolinisation of the granite took place.Granite rock is composed of quartz, mica and feldspar and it is the {feldspar }in the original granite that has been changed into the {kaolin. } The name {kaolin }comes from the Kaoling Hills where China Clay was first mined by the Chinese for use by porcelain makers in the 7th Century. The first man to discover China Clay in Cornwall was {William Cookworthy } who found deposits in the 18thCentury.
